revised_title: On the Relation between Boiling-Point and Composition in Organic Compounds
tldr: The author investigates the relationship between boiling points and composition in organic compounds, focusing on alcohols, acids, and ethers. He presents a series of propositions to calculate boiling points based on composition and demonstrates their accuracy through experimental data. The author also discusses the boiling points of isomers and the importance of considering chemical character in understanding boiling point differences.
